body_html:
LGTM, some ideas for improvement:

  1. Functions in tensorrt_tranformer.cc need better documentation. It is currently cryptic what many of them do and how.
  2. I think referring to a subgraph by start and end nodes is suboptimal, as connected ops in a graph are not always representable by contiguous slice of operator list, and vice versa. std::unordered_set of node indexes would be a better to way to represent a subgraph.
body_text:
LGTM, some ideas for improvement:

Functions in tensorrt_tranformer.cc need better documentation. It is currently cryptic what many of them do and how.
I think referring to a subgraph by start and end nodes is suboptimal, as connected ops in a graph are not always representable by contiguous slice of operator list, and vice versa. std::unordered_set of node indexes would be a better to way to represent a subgraph.
body:
LGTM, some ideas for improvement:
1. Functions in `tensorrt_tranformer.cc` need better documentation. It is currently cryptic what many of them do and how.
2. I think referring to a subgraph by `start` and `end` nodes is suboptimal, as connected ops in a graph are not always representable by contiguous slice of operator list, and vice versa. `std::unordered_set` of node indexes would be a better to way to represent a subgraph.
